title: Remote Code Execution on Git.imgur-dev.com
content:
Hi, Imgur Security Team:
I just found that your GitHub Enterprise Server(https://git.imgur-dev.com/) didn't patch to the latest version(2.8.7). And there is a Rails static key leads to RCE vulnerability!
You can see the PoC from my screenshots :)
steps: Identify that the GitHub Enterprise Server (https://git.imgur-dev.com/) is running an outdated version (below 2.8.7).
Exploit the known Rails static key vulnerability to achieve Remote Code Execution (RCE).
vuln_description: The vulnerability involves exploiting a known Rails static key vulnerability in an outdated version of GitHub Enterprise Server, leading to Remote Code Execution (RCE).
reason: The vulnerability relies on a known issue (Rails static key) in an outdated software version, making it straightforward to exploit once the outdated version is identified. No novel or complex interactions are required.

authnz_metadata.reason: The vulnerability involves a Rails static key leading to RCE on an unpatched GitHub Enterprise Server. This is not an authentication or authorization issue (AuthN/AuthZ or IDOR) but rather a remote code execution vulnerability due to a misconfiguration or unpatched software. The proposed methodologies focus on AuthN/AuthZ and IDOR vulnerabilities, not RCE or software versioning issues.
